Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Motors

Class BaseMotor

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Hardware.Motors.BaseMotor
public class BaseMotor extends Object
The BaseMotor class serves as a wrapper for motor functionality, providing methods for controlling and monitoring motor operations. It interacts with a MotorIO implementation for hardware abstraction.

    Constructs a new BaseMotor instance.

      Periodically updates the motor inputs and processes them using the Logger.

      Retrieves the current position of the motor as a Rotation2d object.
      Returns:
      The motor's position.

    • getVelocity

      public double getVelocity()
      Retrieves the current velocity of the motor.
      Returns:
      The motor's velocity in meters per second.

    • stopMotor

      public void stopMotor()
      Stops the motor and performs a fault check.

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed(double speedInMPS, double mechanismCircumference, boolean isOpenLoop)
      Sets the motor's speed.
      Parameters:
      speedInMPS - The desired speed in meters per second.
      mechanismCircumference - The circumference of the mechanism connected to the motor.
      isOpenLoop - Whether the speed control should be open-loop.

    • setAngle

      public void setAngle(double angleInRotations)
      Sets the motor's angle in rotations.
      Parameters:
      angleInRotations - The desired angle in rotations.

    • setControl

      public void setControl(double volts)
      Sets the motor control voltage for SysID mode.
      Parameters:
      volts - The control voltage to apply.

    • checkForFaults

      public void checkForFaults()
      Performs a fault check on the motor.

    • getCanId

      public int getCanId()
      Retrieves the CAN ID of the motor.
